cmCourseInfo.description: This is the language course to take if you have had no previous experience of the German language. The emphasis is on comprehension, speaking, reading, writing, vocabulary and basic grammar. This course can be counted towards all programs in German. Note: Students with any previous knowledge of German are REQUIRED to take a placement test offered at the department.
cmCourseInfo.title: Introduction to German
cmCourseInfo.exclusionsText: Senior high school German or equivalent. Note: Students with any previous knowledge of German are required to take a placement test offered at the department.

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions
This is an online, synchronous course. If you have ANY background in the German language, you are required to take a placement test. Please email gayle.grisdale@utoronto.ca to book a placement test as soon as possible. The test is a written test and takes thirty minutes. It takes place at the German Department, 50 St. Joseph St., (at Bay St./wing of St. Basil's Church), Odette Hall, 3rd Floor.

cmCourseInfo.description: This course continues the work done in GER100Y1 / GER101H1. It further expands on basic grammar and vocabulary, practice in comprehension, composition, and conversation.
cmCourseInfo.title: Intermediate German 1
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: GER100Y1/GER101H1 or German placement test, Senior high school German or equivalent

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions
This is an online, synchronous course. / Pre-Requirement: Successful completion of GER100Y1 or GER101H1 or their equivalents or permission by the department. Self-placement is not allowed. Please email gayle.grisdale@utoronto.ca for more information.

courses.name: Special Topics Summer Course in Berlin (E)

cmCourseInfo.description: The topics of this course taught in English and open to students from other disciplines vary from year to year. Interested students can address questions to Woodsworth College.
cmCourseInfo.title: Special Topics Summer Course in Berlin (E)

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions
This course has been cancelled and will be offered again in 2021.

cmCourseInfo.description: A reading & research project in Germanic literature and/or culture involving a substantive research component. Not eligible for CR/NCR option.
cmCourseInfo.title: Independent Study
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: Advanced status: permission of the department. Note: permission needs to be obtained by May 1st for the Fall Term and by Nov. 1st for the Spring Term

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions
The deadline for submitting a proposal was in March. In exceptional cases, and if you have already have talked to a faculty member who is willing to support your proposal, please contact gayle.grisdale@utoronto.ca for more information.
